meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm here to give you my two cents on the Braid Anniversary Edition. Now, before I dive into the review, let me just say that I'm no expert critic like those fancy folks over at God is a Geek or PlayStation LifeStyle (although, can we talk about how pretentious their names are?). No, no, I'm just a seasonal grok video game reviewer trying to bring some humor and fun to my reviews.

Okay, now that we've got the intro out of the way, let's get down to business! Braid Anniversary Edition is, in short, a beautiful remake of a classic indie game. The visuals are stunning – think vibrant colors, lush environments, and puzzles that will make your head spin (in a good way, of course). And don't even get me started on the sound design; it's like a symphony for your ears!

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Is this just a rehashing of the old game?" Well, to answer that, let me quote my favorite critic (just kidding, it's actually Push Square): "Whether or not the Anniversary Edition is worth it, however, will largely depend on your experience with the original." For newcomers, the enhanced graphics and extra levels make this a must-play. But for those who have experienced Braid before, unless you're itching for a revisit, there may not be enough new content here to justify double dipping.

And honestly? I'm okay with that. Sometimes, it's nice to just relive some good old memories (or in this case, the original Braid). The Anniversary Edition is a great way to do just that, especially if you're a fan of indie games or just looking for something new and exciting.

Now, before I wrap things up, let me give a quick shoutout to my fellow critics out there. God is a Geek: your 90 score is appreciated, but come on, can't we get some more flair in here? Metro GameCentral: I love how you said Braid "remains as cleverly unique today as it did 16 years ago." That's some top-notch criticism right there! Push Square: thanks for being honest and not just spewing out a bunch of fancy words like some other critics (cough, cough).

In conclusion, the Braid Anniversary Edition is a fantastic remake that will delight both new and old fans of the game. If you haven't played Braid before, now's the perfect time to experience it in all its glory. And if you have, well... it's always nice to revisit some old friends.

So there you have it, folks! My two cents on the Braid Anniversary Edition. Take it for what it's worth – a grok's honest opinion .
